title: [BUG] S3 bucket credentials and URI (env vars) required also (by boto3) on mlflow server side
body:
### Describe the problem
`mlflow server` requires (on the server side) environmental variables with credentials and connections to the S3 bucket (`AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` and `MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL` ), which implies that both server and client connect to the bucket.

### Code to reproduce issue
See #1970, but with boto3 package installed manually.

### Describe the problem
1) `mlflow server's` dependency `botocore` without `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` raises `botocore.exceptions.NoCredentialsError: Unable to locate credentials`
2) `mlflow server's` dependency `botocore` without `MLFLOW_S3_ENDPOINT_URL` variable (but with those from point 1) tries to connect to amazonaws.com (even if running on premise using minio) and raises `botocore.exceptions.SSLError: SSL validation failed for https://mlflow.s3.amazonaws.com/` error

### Other info / logs
1) mlflow server logs - without `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID` and `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` in the mlflow server container:
```

Traceback (most recent call last):
```
